reviewText: I believe that this collection is one of the best on the market and fervently promote it's amazing movies made by some of the best directors and actors in the world. It also tells the story of men not brave heroes or powerful creatures but legendary men and their stories left floating through the sea of time. I would deeply recommend this title to anyone who enjoys great, dynamic, and human dramas.

reviewText: This sapphire collection is a good buy if you do not own any dvd disc of these 3 movies. Otherwise, you can skip this collection. The AV Quality of these 3 blue ray discs is not much distintive improvement over dvd disc, if you watch them on screen small than 100 inches in diagonal. reviewText: My hubby and I have watched Gladiator and Saving Private Ryan so far. The quality of the picture is exceptional. It was nice to see justice done to the brilliance of the photography and cinematography from these films. I was initially worried about quality, since it's an inexpensive three pack, but it more than met expectations. I would highly recommend.
summary: The quality of picture is fabulous
Title: N/A

reviewText: I own all 3 of these seperatly, so I don't know if this particular set comes with all the extras as the seperate ones do, so I will not comment on the extras, I will focus on the movies themselves.It would seem that only the cream of the crop movies from Paramount are receiving this treatment, which they fully deserve as these are the cream of the crop, I'm sure they will do more sapphire series, because they have so many more top rate movies that are so good they deserve treatment like this, but anyways, I first bought 'Gladiator' from this set, and made sure I got the re-released one, and wow, what an improvement over the DVD, and the remastered DVD looked great, but this just takes it to another level, right off during the battle of Germania, you can see the blu ray shine, just look at the fire arrows flying through the air, and the columns of horses charging, wow, so vivid and detailed, and the whole movie is like that, I see no grain at all, and the audio is in your face, scenes that need to be loud are just that, scenes that are more on the quiet side are like they should be, so the audio is crisp and clear, and not over done.'Braveheart' was the second one I bought, and this one might be the best of the bunch, the transfer is just so stunning and beautiful, no grain, colors are as they should be, excellent details, the picture doesn't jump, and the audio is perfect, nice and balanced, I had the DVD of this too, but I sold it after I got this, this is leaps and bounds better, I still like DVD's though too!'Saving Private Ryan' is the 3rd one I bought, I have not watched it yet, but I watched the beginning scene in Omaha Beach, and it is just stunning, the sand, the boats entering, the water, the uniforms, guns, everything just jumps right out at you, and boy, the audio will just blow you away, literally, the audio in itself is an experience, I'm sure the rest of the movies looks and sounds as good as the beginning, I've not seen any complaints from other reviewers, so I will expect the same.I'm still looking to get the 'Forrest Gump' and the first 2 The Godfather's 'Sapphire Series' then my collection will be complete.Now if it was me, I would spend the little extra money and get the individual movies, because you get great extras that make it worth it, but this is still a great deal for this set, I would not complain!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This blu-ray collection is a must have for anybody that enjoys action/drama films.  Braveheart and Gladiator won best picture in their years and Saving Private Ryan was nominated.Braveheart is about the Scottish rebellion in the 13th century led by William Wallace (Mel Gibson).  While the film is full of action and drama, there are plenty of comedic elements to liven things up a bit.  The picture and sound on this disc are fantastic.Gladiator is about a Roman general, Maximus (Russell Crowe) who becomes a gladiator after some unsavory circumstances.  This film was a great test film for surround sound systems for years.  The picture on this film is fantastic.  This is the most recent release of the film and NOT the infamous poor transfer.Saving Private Ryan follows a US infantry squad after D-Day as they search for a soldier to send home.  This is a great World War II film with a fantastic beach landing scene.  There are great characters throughout played by Tom Hanks and Matt Damon.  This is a newer film and as such the picture and sound is great.The only downside to this collection is that the second disc of special features is not included for ANY of the films.  If this is a must have then the only way to get them is an individual purchase.
Title: N/A
